content.description:
Begin with an easy start from the right to C1.

Climb under the bulge to C2, and then pull the bulge with tough pulls and tricky feet to and past a close C3. Continue with a short run on big, flat and techy holds to a reachy C4 with a good stance.

Follow the seam past C5 to the chained anchors.
content.location:
This is at

RAMM Ledge

on the Police Wall.

It is the first route left of the roof.

content.description: Climb reachy holds with tricky feet to C1. Get big holds out right to clip C2. Continue with some sustained climbing for 3 clips, and then it is easy to the anchors.
content.location:
At

Bomb Ledge

, start just left of

Bomb’s Away

.

content.description: Start with tricky climbing to C1. Then climb bigger holds past C2 to C3 to a small break. Continue with vertical climbing on crimpers and thinker feet for 3 clips. Move past the final clip with easier climbing to the chained anchors.
content.location:
Sledge Ledge

, start just right of First Incisions (cold shuts) on the dusty ledge with the large hole.

content.description: Climb big holds to C1. Then continue on vertical climbing on good holds past 2 clips to under the roof. Gain the roof on strenuous pulls to C4, and then move right to clip a close C5. Climb straight up the easier, vertical face past 1 clip to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

Bambi Ledge

, start just right of

Destination Unknown

.

content.description: Start in the "open book" corner, head straight up the bolt line for the full value, or step left about midway up to catch a rest.
content.location:
It is the 1st bolted route to the right of

Climb It Like You Stole It

.

content.description: I know nothing about the route but wanted to list it here on MP to make it less confusing. Please upgrade this description with some actual beta.
content.location:
It is to the climber's right of

Tendon Respite...

and left of

The Silent Treatment

on a panel of the wall all by itself.

content.description: Climb up a black face just right of a chimney. Be cautious as there are some precarious blocks in the chimney, and don't blow the second clip or it might hurt. Reach a ledge, and then climb up an enjoyable black limestone face to the anchor.
Start in the corner for the 1st bolt, and then trend up and right for a sustained, crimpy climb.
content.location:
It starts from Bomb Ledge, one the climber's left end, between

Enola Gay

and

You're the Bomb

as of 2/5/21.

content.description:
This is most likely a MJM route.

It goes up the left side of the shallow cave and trends up and right.
content.location:
It is on the far left side of the rock panel that also holds

Alfalfa Omega

&

Dust Lust

.

content.description: Consider stickclipping the first bolt, or pull a major roof, and then clip C1. Now pull a second roof, and clip C2. Keep cranking up 3 more clips, get the anchors, and do a victory fist pump!
content.location: Hike up the trail, turn left at the wall, hike until you make a hard right, and then it is staring you down.

content.description:
Start off a high, large undercling, and make reachy moves up to a ledge. Work your way up into the corner, and reach for the jugs at the lip with body position-dependent moves. Once at the lip, enjoy the jug party for the pull. Be careful on the ledge over the roof as there are still some large loose rocks up there.

I am looking for more information on this route. If you have any, please add it here! I had a great time on this guy, so I figured I'd add it.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor with rap rings.
content.location:
This ascends the obvious roof between

Crunchy Bunch

and

Reggatta de Blanc

.

content.description:
Start below a horizontal ledge between

Genius Jackson

and

The Royal Scam

. Work your way up to the ledge with pockets and sidepulls to a mantel. Once the ledge is reached, traverse right and slightly up following holds to reach a high step through to a left-facing sidepull. Make a few large pulls on crimps to reach lower angle, sharp crimps to reach the anchor.

Please any information on route name, grade, or FA if known.
content.location:
This is between

Genius Jackson

and

The Royal Scam

on a clean face with 3 green, bed angles.

content.description:
From as small ledge just left of “

Saints are Sinners

,” climb up a black face to the first bolt. Carefully climb past the first bolt (crux), and veer right. The route almost merges with “

Saints are Sinners

” but then cuts back left to a separate anchor.

This is harder than its unknown neighbor to the left.

Climb a vertical face between

The Royal Scam

and

Pitchfork Posse

. It starts up lower angle terrain to reach a sustained sequence of crimps and small pockets up the slightly less than vertical face. Overall, it is lower angle than the unknown 11 two routes to the left. Clean footwork and delicate movement still pay dividends here.

Please add any known info on FA, route description, or grade here if known!
content.location:
The route is between

The Royal Scam

and

Pitchfork Posse

with older silver bolts.

content.description:
From

Sledge Ledge

, gain the low easy slab to the high C1. Continue with vertical climbing past 2 clips to a smallish break. Finish with tough pulls past 2 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
It is in between

The Irishman

&

Show Stopper

.

content.description: Begin with a tricky vertical start on good to smallish holds and ok feet to C1. Pass C1, and climb straight up on great holds and feet past 3 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description:
From

Sledge Ledge

, climb vertical black rock past 3 clips to a break. Continue up the vertical face past 3 clips to the chained anchors.
content.protection: 7 clips to easy lowering Mussy hooks.
content.location:
At

Sledge Ledge

, this is the first route left of unknown or first route uphill from

The Irishman

.

climbs.name: Tendon Respite aka Who Done It?

content.description:
Begin on the same ledge as

Bambi Meets Godzilla

, about 250 feet left of

Dust Lust

. Both routes climb unprotected rock for about fifteen feet.

Bambi...

is on the left, Tendon Respite heads right and follows four bolts to the same anchors. Reaching first bolt is easier than it first appears, but be careful of loose holds down low. Clip the first bolt, step right directly below second bolt, and climb straight up to anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts + anchor, "S" or "R" rating for first bolt runout.

content.description: Begin with a steep start to a low C1. Move right for the big holds to C2. Continue with vertical climbing straight up past 4 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

Bambi Ledge

, s

tart several feet left of

EBTG

.

climbs.name: The Sun Always Shines on TV

content.description: Climb big liebacks in the large flake system past 3 clips to a stance. Move straight up on nice hands and feet past 3 clips to the anchors.
content.protection:
6 clips to anchors.

A belay bolt is in place for your safety.
content.location: It is the furthest route left in the RAMM Alcove.

content.description: Start with tricky, thin, fingery moves in the small corner past 3 clips to under the bulge. Pull the bulge on the right, and climb up and left for 4 clips to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 clips to chained anchors. A belay bolt is in place for your safety.
content.location:
At

Bambi Ledge

, it is the second route right of the Bambi face or just right of the west-facing unknown route.

content.description: Start on the gray slab to clip C1. Climb blond vertical rock for 2 clips to a small stance. Climb a tough crux on righty sidepulls, mini-pockets, and bad feet for 2 clips on the short headwall to big holds to the chained anchors.
content.location: Sledge Ledge.

climbs.name: She Used to be My Girl

content.description: Climb a vertical, black slab start past C1. Clip C2, bear right, and then cruise straight up the cruxy face to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

RAMM Ledge

, start in between

Pitchfork Posse

&

Crack Nite

.

content.description: Enjoy fun climbing up the beautiful black face with great but reachy holds.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description: Begin with vertical, juggy climbing on big holds past 3 clips. Move up the nice face past 4 clips on good crimpers and edgy feet, and end with a tricky finish to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

Bambi Ledge

,

once up the initial trail scramble, this is the third route from the right.

content.description: Start in the hollow, righty flake past C1. Do a tricky move to C2 and a small stance. Follow the seam on good feet and hands past 3 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
In

RAMM Alcove

, this is in between 2 old routes. This is the left seam that makes up the initial vertical wall when going to the RAMM Alcove.

content.description: Begin with a steep, overhanging start to C1 then thin moves to C2 and small stance. Climb straight up the black face with thinker moves to the anchors.
content.location:
RAMM Ledge

, start left of Unknown roof route.

content.description: Start with tricky climbing in the small inset to C1. Move left with smallish, lefty sidepulls then bigger holds up to C3 and a stance. Follow the right crack and left face to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, start around the corner from

A Sharp

.

content.description: Start on the obvious, large flake to C1. Move straight up on great holds past a brief steep section to the chained anchors.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description:
Start just right of

MP

with a dusty start to C1. Get great holds to C2 then fingery holds past C2 to C4. Climb cruxy moves to C5 to the chained anchors.
content.location: Bambi Ledge.

content.description: Begin with an easy start to C1. Continue on fun, vertical climbing on nice holds and feet past 3 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
In

RAMM Alcove

, start just right of

Kid Charlemagne

.

content.description: Climb big holds to C1. Move to C2, then follow the seam for 3 clips to the anchors.
content.protection:
5 clips to Mussy hooks provided by

www.safeclimbing.org

.
content.location:
It starts in

RAMMA Alcove.

content.description: Begin with easy climbing past C1 to a dusty stance. Move straight up the wide crack system on big holds past 3 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
In

RAMM Alcove

, it is s

everal feet right and downhill from

Heart & Soul

.

content.description: Begin with a crack start past C1 and C2 to a ledge. Climb straight up using the vertical face on the left and wide crack on the right past 3 clips to the chained anchors.
content.protection:
5 clips to Mussy hooks provided by

www.safeclimbing.org

.
content.location:
Begin on

RAMM Ledge.

content.description: If you can stem off the back block, this route is easier. There are good holds to a high C1 out left. Stem or don't stem up to C2 on reachy hands. There are good feet in the crease past C3 to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, this is the first route right of

Nine to Noon

.

content.description: Begin with easy climbing in the small corner past 2 clips to a stance. Continue on beautiful gray stone with hard to read holds and not so good feet past 2 clips and an easy exit to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, this is the first route right of

Husker Nation

.

content.description:
Start just right of

WRST

, with easy climbing to C1. Move to the corner with great sidepulls and good feet for 3 clips. Finish with tricky climbing with liebacks, crimpers, and some sharp rock for 4 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location: Sledge Ledge.

content.description: Begin with steep, tricky climbing with the big holds under C1. Continue straight up on big holds and a nice stance. Finish with easier climbing up the black, vertical face to the anchors.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description: Climb tricky opening moves for 3 clips to a small break. Move over the easy, juggy bulge then a not-so-easy bulge to the anchors.
content.location:
On

RAMM Ledge

, it is the first route encountered where the trail meets the wall.

content.description: Begin with easy, slabby face climbing past 2 clips to the corner. Climb the lefty corner and righty face for 3 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
In the

RAMM Alcove

, s

tart right of the corner or the first route right of old mixed route

Anarchy X

.

content.description: Begin with a steep start to C1. Move straight up on sidepulls, crimpy edges, and then big holds past 3 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, start just left of

P.A. & Charch

.

content.description: Climb the crack and face holds, and expect it to get a bit thin halfway up.
content.protection: A standard rack on up to a #6.
content.location: Hike up the trail, turn left at the wall, keep hiking and at the first hard right turn, and look up and right.

content.description: Stickclip C1, because your belayer has little wiggle room. Climb a bulgy start on big holds for 2 clips. Move up and right to a small stance. Gain the short face and then easy, vertical face to the chained anchors.
content.protection:
6 clips to chained anchors.

This route has a very small belay stance. Stickclip the first bolt! A belay bolt maybe added for your belayer.
content.location:
At

East Side

, this is the first route right of

Hipster Doofus

.

content.description: Scramble up several feet to start. Climb sweet fingerlocks and face moves with pretty good feet for 3 clips to under the bulge. Move over the bulge on big holds then tricky holds to C4. Move straight up past 2 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, this is the first route right of

Dust Lust

.

content.description: Start just left of the corner on big holds past 2 clips to a stance. Follow the obvious, large, black flake to a stance on top of the flake. Move up the nice face past 2 clips to the anchors.
content.location: Bambi Ledge.

content.description: Begin with vertical climbing on blond rock to and past C1 to a very small stance. Climb tricky moves to reachy fingery pockets with thinker feet past two clips. Move up and left to the anchors.
content.location: Sledge Ledge.

content.description: Do a pull up for the bouldery start to C1 to a nice ledge. Climb the short face then vertical bulgy face past 4 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

RAMM Ledge

, start several feet right of

Pear Shaped

.

content.description:
Climb big holds for 3 clips.

Continue straight up past 7 more clips with fun, varied, vertical climbing to the anchors.
content.location:
This is at

Sledge Ledge.

At the fork in the trail, go left. This is the first route right before the short incline.

A big boulder is located right in front of the route.

content.description: Begin with easy, big holds to C1. Climb the sweet, open book corner with great feet and abundant hand holds on the right and left faces and nice fingers in the corner to a stance out right of C4 to the anchors.
content.location:
In

RAMM Alcove

, it is just right of

Play a Volta

.

content.description: Begin with a vertical start on gray rock to C1. Follow the seam past several clips to beneath the vertical bulge. Move left or right past two clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
Begin on

Sledge Ledge.

content.description: Begin with a crack start past C1. Climb straight up to C2 and steepening rock to C3. Pull the small bulge on the right past C4 to the anchors.
content.location:
In

RAMM Alcove

, start right of

Impending Doom

.

content.description: Begin with flakes and face holds to C1 and a stance. Continue up a tricky face to liebacky to face climbing past 4 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, start just right of

Fumblerooski

.

content.description: Begin with a bulgy start on good holds to C1. Follow the righty flake system for 2 clips to a stance. Gain the vertical face for 2 clips to the anchors.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description: Start in the short, easy corner to clip the very high C1 and a stance. Clip C2, and move through tricky moves to another stance. Follow the blunt arete on good edges, pockets, and pretty good feet to the chained anchors.
content.location: Sledge Ledge.

content.description: Start on the dusty slab to the high first clip. Climb a short section of black rock for 2 clips. There is a bit of a runout to C3 on good holds below the cruxy face. Move right for the better holds past 2 clips to C5. Finish with steep climbing on thinker holds with good feet past 3 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
On

Sledge Ledge

, use the same start I think as Stone Cold Bush? Anyways, climb up to C1.

content.description:
Begin up lower angle face climbing on continuous crimps and small pockets. The climb progressively steepens to reach a bulge at the top. Pull the bulge to reach lower angle terrain and the chains. This route climbs small holds and uses good footwork.

If anything more is known about the FA or route description, please add!
content.location:
This is around the corner to the left of

Kid Charlemagne

.

content.description: Start on nice, black rock on big holds to a smallish ledge. Climb straight up past the left blond face, humongous righty flake, and then face moves to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, this is the first route right of

Bits & Pieces

.

content.description: Scramble up several feet to start. Stick clip C1. Climb a tricky, bulgy, vertical start in a hand crack for 2 clips to C3. Continue with easier, vertical climbing on great holds past 3 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, this is the first route left of

MRS Curse

.

content.description: Climb the short, big, right-facing block past 3 clips to a big stance on top of the block. Move to the lefty corner and righty face past C4 to the anchors.
content.location:
In

RAMM Alcove

, it is right of

The Last in Line

.

content.description:
Use the same start as

Pet Your Friends

, but bust right. Begin with an easy start on scruffy rock to C1. Follow the small prow and lefty crack on big hand holds and good feet past 3 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
In

RAMM Alcove

, this is just left of the old 3 green bed angle route with open shuts for anchors.

content.description: Begin with a vertical start on nice holds in a small seam to under the bulge. Pull the bulge on the right, and cruise straight up the easy face to the anchors.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description: Start on the lower black face to and past C1 to a stance. Move straight up the vertical, black face on good to smaller holds past 4 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, start just right of

Husker Nation

.

content.description: Climb a juggy, pocketed start to C1. Move straight up the face past 2 clips to a small stance out left. Gain the tricky arete with lefty sidepulls and sharp, righty edges to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, start several feet right of

Fire Marshall Bill

.

content.description: Climb a tricky crack start to C1. Continue on juggy holds past 2 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

East Side

, start several feet right of

P.A. & Charch

.

content.description:
Start at the base of a right-angling crack with possibilities for a hand jam/finger lock to reach a ledge past two bolts. Then follow a left-facing dihedral with great stemming and laybacking for 5 more bolts to the top of the cliff band.

If you have any more details on this route, please add them here. I jumped on this guy at the end of the day and had such a good time that I wanted to do it again, so I figured I'd post it here.
content.location: From the top of the trail to the Bambi Ledge, scamper up the hill to the right. It is in the corner at the far right corner of the ledge.

content.description: Begin with a steep, sustained start on big pockets to mini-pockets and crimpers with small feet to C3. Move up with easier climbing to a nice rest. Follow the right face and left arete past 4 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

Bambi Ledge

, s

tart about 10 feet right of the

SAS

.

content.description: Start with easy climbing to C1. Continue with nice, vertical climbing on edges and pockets to and past 6 clips to the chained anchors. This has fun climbing up the blond, vertical face.
content.location:
At

East Side

, start 20 right of

MRS Curse

.

content.description: Climb the nice righty corner past 4 clips. Move over the bulge and up the face / corner past 2 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

Bambi Ledge

, it is in between Everything but the Girl and

Destination Unknown

.

climbs.name: Es ist einfach, nichts zu tun

content.description: Jump up on the ledge, and gain the hollow block to C1. Move straight up the blond face past 4 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description: Move into the corner for 2 clips, then bust up and left to a tricky stance. Follow the smallish fingery flake to a stance on top of the flake. Climb past 2 clips to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 clips to chained anchors. A belay bolt is in place for your safety.
content.location:
Bomb Ledge,

do the same start as unknown.

content.description:
This is located far on the North side of the North wall of The Bank, above some unrestricted parking.  A steep scree filled trail leads to the base of the wall.

Alfalfa Omega

(10b) is on the face immediately right and

A Sharp

(10a) is around the corner to the right.

Bambi Meets Godzilla

(10c) is 200+ feet to the left.  Watch loose rock up to the first bolt, then the climbing turn clean and mean real quick.  Pull the balancy crux move out to the arete and follow the fun face above.
Begin with an easy start to C1. Then climb a not so easy bulge to the anchors.
content.location:
It is just left of

Nine to Noon

.

content.description: Climb big holds for 2 clips to the start of the business at C3. Gain the blond face with fingery, sustained moves and OK feet to under the small bulge. Tackle the bulge on the right past 2 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

Bambi Ledge

, it is in between

Everything But The Girl

and

Walking in L.A.

content.description: Begin with nice, vertical climbing on big pockets and edges to and past C2. Move straight up for 2 clips on beautiful black slabby rock to the chained anchors.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description:
This is the very rightmost route in the RAMM Alcove with 3 green, bed angle bolts. It starts up a short face to a ledge. From the ledge, work through a bulge to an upper face on thin hands and good footwork to reach an upper face and weakness.

Please add any known info on FA and route description if known.
content.location:
It is the very first route at the far right side of the alcove right of

Pitchfork Posse

.

climbs.name: Climb It Like You Stole It

content.description: Chossy foot holds get you started into great hand jams right from the get go. Follow the right-leaning crack through the first bulge on thin feet, and then get a good rest on the huge ledge before the next section of hand jams and feet on the face.
content.protection: Gear up to 4" with a bolted anchor up top.
content.location: Look for the distinctive crack that is posted in the photo.

content.description: Climb an easy start to C1. Move straight up past several clips on nice hand holds and feet left of the long crack system. Join the crack system near C6, and then move up and left to the chained anchors.
content.location:
At

Sledge Ledge

, start just right of

I'll See the Light Tonight

.

content.description: Start on the left side of the crack. Do a vertical start to C1 on nice holds but tricky feet to C2. Move straight up past C3 to the small bulge. Move past the bulge on big holds past C5 to the chained anchors.
content.location: RAMM Ledge.

content.description:
This route is located on the Quarry Wall to the right of

Dust Lust

.  This is the crack system that runs up the face and into the corner to the left of

B Flat

.  The crack is excellent with very fun under cling moves around the bulge at the top.  Easily protected.
content.protection:
Pro to 2" Use the anchors for

B Flat

.

content.description: Begin with a tricky start past C1 to C2 to big, flat holds to C3. Climb straight up the vertical, bulgy face past 2 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
RAMM Ledge

.

content.description: Bugenhagen has a bulgy start on big holds to a spacious stance. Move up and right past 3 clips to another stance. Continue with tricky, reachy climbing past C4 to easier climbing with a bit of a run to the chained anchors.
content.location:
Start just left of

Toxic B.S.

content.description: Leave the small cams, and just bring your big stuff. I used doubles of #3-#6. I would have used a Big Bro if I had 'em. This has sharp rock and lots of face holds if offwidths aren't your strong suit.
content.protection: Gear from a #3 through a #6 works great.
content.location: Hike up the trail, turn left at the wall and at the first hard right turn, and look up and right.

content.description: Start on the large flake (a little hollow up high) on huge holds past 2 clips to a stance. Climb the tricky face past 3 clips, and then it is easier climbing past 1 clip to the anchors.
content.location:
At

Bomb Ledge

, this is the first route encountered.

content.description:
Start just right of

OTH

with easy climbing to a high C1. Move straight up the wide crack on big holds past 2 clips. Move right then straight up the corner. Gain the face on the right past 1 clip to the chained anchors.
content.protection:
7 clips to Mussy hooks provided by

www.safeclimbing.org

.
content.location:
On

Sledge Ledge

, this is the second route encountered when coming up the initial trail.

content.description: Begins about 25 ft. around the corner to the right of A Sharp. Climb steep rock and smooth holds past four bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.

North end of North side of The Bank, see

Dust Lust

for approach.  Climbs delicately to the first bolt.  A difficult mantle move at half height leads one easily to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor.  Belayer might want to anchor as belay ledge is not wide and cliffs out below.

content.description: Bach & Roll has an easy start with a juggy, hollow, small flake to C1. Gain tough pulls in the righty seam with crimpy left face holds to C2 and then bigger holds to C3 at the bulge. Climb straight up past the bulge on vertical, cruxy climbing to and past C5 to a small break. Climb the cruxy blond face past 2 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
This is the first route left of

Missing Persons

or 20 feet right of

The Silent Treatment

.

content.description:
Begins about 30 ft. right of Dust Lust on a left facing wall that contains two bolted routes. B Flat is the leftmost route.

Note: There is a discrepancy concerning which of these two routes is A Sharp. Van Horn's guide shows the route to the left as A Sharp (previously identified in this database as B Flat - see route C Major)  and does not identify the route on the right. For clarity and consistency, this description refers to the rightmost route as A Sharp and the left route as B Flat.

Climbs thin, painful holds past five clips to a two bolt anchor. Very sharp holds and consistently awkward body positions made this climb seem a bit difficult for the grade, especailly when compared to it's 5.10b neighbor to the right.

Start up the easy face to the right of

The Sun Always Shines on TV

through good horizontals. Reach the upper face where there are two bolts. Make large pulls on pockets and crimps to reach a large span back to the crack at the left side of the upper bulge.

For full value, be sure to make this span back right to pull the bulge. The top section can be climbed well to the left of the bolt line on large hands and feet at 5.10c/d.
content.protection: 2 bolts, a cam (green-yellow BD) for the low section, and bolted anchors.
content.location:
The mixed route just right of

The Sun Always Shines on TV

.

content.description: The crux is in between the second and third bolt. All the holds are positive, with some different rock half way up. Ledges, pockets, and crimps make this a must do if your in the area.
content.location:
This route is on The Quarry Wall to the left of

Dust Lust

. This route starts over the top of an arch. You might want to stick clip the first bolt.

content.description:
Begins about 30 feet right of

Dust Lust

on a left-facing wall that contains two bolted routes. A Sharp is the rightmost route.

Note: There is a discrepancy concerning which of these two routes is A Sharp. Van Horn's guide shows the route to the left as A Sharp (previously identified in this database as

B Flat

- see route

C Major

)  and does not identify the route on the right. For clarity and consistency, this description refers to the rightmost route as A Sharp and the left route as

B Flat

.

Fun opening moves lead up a shallow, left-facing dihedral and over a short roof to a number of painful one and two finger pockets. Much easier than its 5.10b neighbor to the left.
